duties_responsibilities.duty: Work alongside other engineers, chemists, and scientists to develop improved production processes and methods.
Conduct research to develop new and improved manufacturing processes.
Design and plan the layout of equipment.
Operating, maintaining, and testing machinery, fixing faults when necessary.
Establishing safety procedures for working with dangerous chemicals.
Sampling and conducting tests and monitor production processes.
Evaluating equipment and processes to ensure compliance with safety and environmental regulations.
Managing quality control and inspecting the final product.
Selecting and setting up the required lab equipment for tests, experiments, and analyses.
Conducting lab tests for qualitative and quantitative analyses of various substances and materials.
Maintain excellent lab records, analyze results, and provide preliminary interpretation to scientists.
Interpreting test results and compiling technical reports.
Keeping up-to-date with field advancements and sharing new knowledge with colleagues.
Keeping the laboratory neat and clean and sterilizing all work surfaces and equipment.
Regularly inspecting materials and equipment and ordering more as required.
Researching ways to make production more efficient, cost-effective and to reduce pollution.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, or related field (Master’s degree preferred)
2+ years technical experience in a chemical or engineering field
